You also get a chest for the champion you're playing if anyone in your premade achieves an S rank, and then you can't earn further chests for the champion you were playing at the time until the next season. Did you happen to unlock a chest as Lee Sin when another player in your premade achieved S rank on their champion previously to achieving S rank with Lee Sin? 

Each champion you play can earn you one chest per season, so if that was the case, you'd need to achieve S rank on a different champ to get a chest unlocked until the next season starts. Apologies if any of that was confusing -- let me know if this isn't the case for you.

So basically if I win a a chest as any champion, even if I didn't get an S rank myself, then it counts as an unlock for that champion?

That being said, I think it might actually might be bugged because I've seen multiple people claiming to not have gotten chests.
Yes, that is correct. You can get the chest if another player in your premade earns an S ranking and you haven't received a chest for that champion yet this season.

Quick question. If you AND a teammate both get S rank, do you get multiple chests in one game? Or does it randomly select one champion from which to give everyone a chest?

So if you and a member of your premade both get an S rank, nothing really changes. You each earn chests for the champion you are playing at the time. Here's an example:

If you and I are on a premade and I choose Annie and you choose Udyr, let's say you get and I both get an S rank. That means we both earn one chest; I earn a chest for Annie, and you earn one for Udyr. If only you achieve an S rank and I get let's say a C rank (much more likely for me haha) I will still get a chest for Annie, and you will get a chest for Udyr. Hopefully that makes a bit more sense, but let me know if I can clarify further for you :)

@MarshmallowBob, This literally makes no sense. Yes, I understand how it works, but why would you tie chest achievements for individual champion performance, and then give out chests to those who didn't earn that performance rating? 

Isn't the point "Earn an S, you get a chest". Inspiring people to play better and learn more champs?

Rather than, "Earn an S, you get a chest... but earn a D we'll still give you one anyway cause your teammate carried you". This is like getting a "A for Effort", or "Participant" trophy. It completely diminishes the sense of pride you get from playing well on that champ and earning your reward.

Earning chests should only be unlocked by individual performance on that champ. Rewarding players for a stellar performance, and rewarding players for expanding their champion pools.

PS: This also dramatically reduces your store revenue. You are giving out more potential free products, to those who haven't earned it, and creating an unsatisfactory experience for those who have. (I worked hard and finally earned an S on XX champ, but didn't receive any reward cause some guy in another game I played poorly in earned it for me)
